exhibitionname: Van Gogh in Auvers-sur-Oise: His Final Months
Description: This exhibition focused on the last months of Van Gogh's life, showcasing works created during his time in Auvers-sur-Oise.

exhibitionname: Choosing Vincent: From Family Inheritance to World-Famous Collection
Description: This exhibition explored how Van Gogh's family played a pivotal role in preserving and promoting his work, leading to his global recognition.

exhibitionname: Van Gogh: The Road to Paris
Description: This exhibition traced Van Gogh's journey from the Netherlands to Paris and his formative years in the French capital.
Focused on Van Gogh's early works, showing his development from amateur sketches to the groundbreaking works he is known for today.

exhibitionname: Van Gogh and the Artists of the South
Description: An exploration of Van Gogh’s influence on the artists of southern France during his time in Arles and Saint-Rémy.

exhibitionname: The Last Years of Van Gogh
Description: Focusing on the final years of Van Gogh’s life, this exhibition featured works he painted during his time in the asylum in Saint-Rémy.
Explored Van Gogh's reclusive lifestyle and his mental health struggles through letters, personal documents, and his paintings.

exhibitionname: Van Gogh and the Light of the South
Description: Examined how Van Gogh's time in southern France influenced his use of color and his iconic works, such as 'The Yellow House' and 'The Olive Trees.'

exhibitionname: Van Gogh and the Modern World
Description: This exhibition explored how Van Gogh’s art influenced modern and contemporary art movements.

exhibitionname: Van Gogh: The Soul of the Painter
Description: A deep dive into the emotional and psychological aspects of Van Gogh's works, exploring his connection to color and light.
